physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe Cushing's disease, locally aggressive pituitary tumor eroding the floor of the sella and extending into the sphenoidal sinus. Tumor tissue showed ACTH positivity, high mitotic numbers, atypical nuclei, Ki-67 40%, p53 positive.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After initial surgery, ACTH transiently decreased to 11 pmol/L and s-cortisol to 42 nmol/L. ACTH increased to 43000 pmol/L with elevation of liver enzymes after 10 months post-bilateral adrenalectomy, indicating metastases.
